posts.name: Randy Anderson
posts.cooked:
Having a strange issue with Kraken swerve drive motors (propulsion, not steering).  We are commanding duty cycle from the Rio to the Krakens using the CANivore network.  This network has 4x Krakens, 4x CANcoders, and 1x Pigeon.

The problem is that the duty cycle command is stepping to 0 at what seems to be random times causing the robot to suddenly slow down.  Shortly after this the duty cycle command jumps back up to the expected value.  The robot drives very harshly when this is happening.  There doesn’t seem to be a correlation with level of duty cycle command, battery voltage, or programming configuration (c++).

See the attached picture that shows the Rio output duty cycle / motor speed on the left and the Phoenix Tuner recorded duty cycle / motor speed on the right.  The Phoenix Tuner data was recorded from the driver station (not hard wired) so there doesn’t seem to be a CAN communication issue since data is streaming through during the dropout.  Also, the Rio is receiving the motor speed data during the dropout.  Tried a different CANivore with the same result.

Code

GitHub - DERT-2040/2025_Robot Contribute to DERT-2040/2025_Robot development by creating an account on GitHub.

Contribute to DERT-2040/2025_Robot development by creating an account on GitHub.

Any ideas? duty_cycle_dropout_both_screens 1920×985 132 KB

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked: Looks like you have all CTRe devices. Why not use the phoenix tuner swerve drive generator

posts.name: Randy Anderson
posts.cooked: We have NEOs for steering motors.

posts.name: Lavi Arzi
posts.cooked: Does this happen across all motors?

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked: Have you checked if it’s a limit switch or soft limit issue?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.name: Randy Anderson
posts.cooked: From what I read the Krakens do not support hardware limit switches and we are not using any soft limits in our code.

posts.name: Randy Anderson
posts.cooked: I believe so, but I’ll double check.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Can you plot the current? Do you have current limits enabled?
